intro: Pericycla, commonly known as the "false flax," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Onagraceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce small, four-petaled flowers. They are often found in moist habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Pericycla species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their delicate appearance.
